title: Old Sessions remain valid after the password change.

profile.name: RelateIQ
profile.about: Goodbye, Relationship Management. Hello, Relationship Intelligence.

vulnerability_information:
**Industry Standard Procedure**
When the password is changed or email address has been updated for any particular account,all the sessions which were active with the old password/email should be destroyed.
**Reason**
If somehow anybody hacked into your account and you understand that someone has trespassed into your account,then what will you do?You will change your password to secure your account.But in relateIQ changing the password doesnot destroys the other sessions which are logged in with old passwords.So,your account remains insecure even after the changing of password.

activities.message: I do feel that this is wrong.Its your policy to active two sessions at a time.But the second session should be destroyed once the password is been changed.This is the industry standard.I explained why the session should be destroyed.The same bug was affecting hackerone also.And when it was reported they resolved the issue.

activities.message:
Even you can take the example of Facebook also.Once the password is changed,all the old sessions are destroyed to keep the account safe.
Again explaining:
Suppose someone hacked into my account,and started monitoring my activities silently.At some point I understood that there is someone who is spying on my activities.Then what will I do? Definitely I will change my password to make my account safe.But unfortunately relateIQ does not provide this facility to its clients.So,after changing the password also the old sessions remains valid.
I think you should consider the issue.Doesnt matter whether it is rewarded or not...but I do suggest you to resolve it.
